elements.title: Rhino Boy Chris
elements.contents: ... that Rhino Boy Chris (pictured) has run 113 marathons wearing a rhinoceros costume to raise awareness for rhino conservation?

elements.title: Miss Behave's Mavericks
elements.contents: ... that Miss Behave's Mavericks, a Las Vegas variety show, urges audience members to toss balled up one-dollar bills at performers?

elements.title: letter from a grieving pregnant widow to her deceased husband
elements.contents: ... that a 1586 letter from a grieving pregnant widow to her deceased husband became a sensation in South Korea after it was rediscovered in 1998?

elements.title: Mark Mulvoy
elements.contents: ... that after Mark Mulvoy hosted a party, he was reportedly grabbed by the throat for "trying to ruin" the Boston Red Sox?

elements.title: Battle of Shangi
elements.contents: ... that the Battle of Shangi ended when the Congo Free State commander personally shot the leader of the opposing Rwandan army?

elements.title: Walter Ben Hare
elements.contents: ... that dramatist Walter Ben Hare became wealthy by writing plays that were rarely performed professionally?

elements.title: Selby rail crash
elements.contents: ... that a Land Rover driver falling asleep led to the Selby rail crash?

elements.title: Driocephalus cerebrinoxius
elements.contents: ... that the parasitic copepod Driocephalus cerebrinoxius burrows into the brains of sharks through their noses?

elements.title: Robert Allen Norris
elements.contents: ... that Robert Allen Norris wrote his PhD dissertation on the brown-headed nuthatch (Sitta pusilla) and the pygmy nuthatch (Sitta pygmaea), later calling it "A Tale of Two Sittas"?
